urls.title: Overview of the implementation of COVID-19 vaccination strategies and deployment plans in the EU/EEA
urls.description: This report provides an updated overview of the progress of national COVID-19 vaccination strategies in EU/EEA countries, including updates on: vaccine uptake overall and by target group; vaccination strategies and policies in place; vaccine acceptance and hesitancy; and challenges countries face with increasing uptake and good practices to mitigate these challenges.

📌 Commissioners @dreynders and @YlvaJohansson give a press conference on travel within and from outside the EU 🧳✈️🚘🇪🇺 

🎥📸 Videos and pictures here: https://t.co/p0JhABXTdT https://t.co/Mzc7EtMEEi

We propose an update on measures restricting free movement within the EU.

In light of new coronavirus variants, it is necessary to strongly discourage non-essential travel, while ensuring that the functioning of the Single Market remains uninterrupted.

#StrongerTogether

In parallel, we propose stronger requirements for international travellers into the EU: testing, quarantines and a future common European Passenger Locator Form. 

We need to stop the spread of the virus variants & keep us all safe. 

Together, we will overcome this pandemic.

We update the colour code of @ECDC_EU maps & apply stricter measures for travellers from higher risk areas.

At the same time we need to avoid border closures & keep the Single Market flowing.

People need to have access to essential goods like food or medicine now more than ever

The situation in Europe with the new variants have led us to take difficult but necessary decisions. 

We need to keep safe & discourage non-essential travel.

Today we propose new measures on travel in the EU. We will continue coordinating at 27: it’s the only way to succeed.

To ensure each #COVID19vaccine is used safely and effectively, recommendations & precautions are available for:
✔️healthcare professionals, in the summary of product characteristics
✔️patients, in the package leaflet. 
These are available in all 🇪🇺 languages. #EMAPublicMeeting2

Section 4.4 of the #Comirnaty product information says that cases of anaphylaxis have been reported. Appropriate medical treatment & supervision should always be readily available if an anaphylactic reaction follows administration of the vaccine. #EMAPublicMeeting2

@j_tiltman @vonderleyen @moderna_tx Vaccination is important to prevent people becoming ill with #COVID19. Vaccines alone will not allow us immediately to return to normal life. Other public health measures, e.g. masks & social distancing remain important.

@pmcniffe @juneshannon EMA cannot provide medical advice to people. The use of #COVID19vaccines in patients with certain conditions should be decided in close consultation with a healthcare professional after considering the benefits & risks in the product information of the vaccine.

Key elements for vaccination strategies in 🇪🇺:

➡️capacity to deliver #COVID19vaccines
➡️easy & affordable access for target populations;
➡️deployment of vaccines with different characteristics and storage & transport needs
➡️clear communication to citizens.

#EMAPublicMeeting2

Independent studies of #COVID19vaccines coordinated in the 🇪🇺 will give more information on the #COVID19vaccine’s long-term safety and effectiveness. Member States may also carry out their own additional studies at national level.
#EMAPublicMeeting2

Vaccination is important to prevent people becoming ill with #COVID19. Vaccines alone will not allow us immediately to return to normal life. Other public health measures, e.g. masks & social distancing remain important. #EMAPublicMeeting2

If fewer people are getting sick, particularly among elderly & healthcare workers, the huge burden of #COVID19 on #healthcare systems will be reduced. If we can prevent people from having to go to hospital, more resources to treat other illnesses will be freed. #EMAPublicMeeting2

Conditional marketing authorisation is the EU’s regulatory mechanism for use in the current #COVID19 pandemic emergency, to grant all citizens in 🇪🇺 access to a vaccine and to support mass vaccination campaigns. #EMAPublicMeeting2

There are limited data on immunocompromised people. Although these people may not respond as well to the vaccine, no particular safety concerns are anticipated. These citizens can still be vaccinated as they may be at higher risk from #COVID19. #EMAPublicMeeting2

Both #COVID19vaccines authorised in the 🇪🇺 are given as 2 injections, usually into the muscle of the upper arm:
➡️Comirnaty (BioNTech/Pfizer) is given at least 21 days apart
➡️Moderna COVID-19 vaccine is given 28 days apart
#EMAPublicMeeting2
mRNA from #COVID19vaccines doesn’t stay in the body but is broken down shortly after vaccination. #EMAPublicMeeting2
Very large trials showed that the mRNA vaccines are very effective at preventing #COVID19. Both showed > 90% efficacy and adequate safety profile in clinical trials. #EMAPublicMeeting2

Sabine Straus, PRAC Chair: Additional resources have been mobilised to monitor and assess new safety information as it becomes available. For all #COVID19vaccines, strengthened reporting obligations for companies have been put in place.
Sabine Straus, PRAC Chair: The EU has an excellent safety surveillance system, with state-of-the-art analysis and detection, to ensure that we identify new or changing safety information.

Sabine Straus, PRAC Chair: The PRAC is very aware of our responsibility to EU citizens to collect and analyse every piece of information on the safety of the vaccine. The safety profile of the #COVID19vaccine from the data we have assessed is reassuring.
Harald Enzmann, CHMP Chair: The main #ClinicalTrial for this vaccine, which enrolled over 43,000 people, is one of the largest we have ever evaluated for a vaccine. https://t.co/qOyMcYLI4y

Emer Cooke, EMA's Exec. Director: We owe citizens transparency so they can decide on vaccination based on facts. EMA will publish information on the assessment, including all clinical data assessed in the application. This will allow further independent scrutiny from scientists.

Emer Cooke, EMA's Exec. Director: The conditional marketing authorisation ensures an agreed plan with legally binding obligations on companies, making sure that additional data will be generated and submitted to EMA after the approval.

Emer Cooke, EMA's Exec. Director: EMA’s scientific assessment is based on the strength of the scientific evidence on the vaccine’s safety, quality and efficacy, and nothing else. The evidence convincingly shows that benefits are greater than the risks of this #COVID19vaccine.
